trans-unit.source: In your app project, open the file `AndroidManifest.xml`.
trans-unit.target: In your app project, open the file `AndroidManifest.xml`.

trans-unit.source: In the code in the next two steps, replace _`**my_app_package**`_ with the name of the app package for your project, which is the value of the `package` attribute of the `manifest` tag.
trans-unit.target: In the code in the next two steps, replace _`**my_app_package**`_ with the name of the app package for your project, which is the value of the `package` attribute of the `manifest` tag.

trans-unit.source: Download and unzip the [Mobile Services Android SDK], open the **notifications** folder, copy the **notifications-1.0.1.jar** file to the *libs* folder of your Eclipse project, and refresh the *libs* folder.
trans-unit.target: Download and unzip the [Mobile Services Android SDK], open the **notifications** folder, copy the **notifications-1.0.1.jar** file to the *libs* folder of your Eclipse project, and refresh the *libs* folder.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The numbers at the end of the file name may change in subsequent SDK releases.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The numbers at the end of the file name may change in subsequent SDK releases.

trans-unit.source: Change the definition of the *MobileServiceClient* from **private** to **public static**, so it now looks like this:
trans-unit.target: Change the definition of the *MobileServiceClient* from **private** to **public static**, so it now looks like this:

trans-unit.source: Next we need to add a new class to handle notifications.
trans-unit.target: Next we need to add a new class to handle notifications.

trans-unit.source: In the Package Explorer, right-click the package (under the `src` node), click **New**, click **Class**.
trans-unit.target: In the Package Explorer, right-click the package (under the `src` node), click **New**, click **Class**.

trans-unit.source: In **Name** type `MyHandler`, in **Superclass** type `com.microsoft.windowsazure.notifications.NotificationsHandler`, then click **Finish**
trans-unit.target: In **Name** type `MyHandler`, in **Superclass** type `com.microsoft.windowsazure.notifications.NotificationsHandler`, then click **Finish**

trans-unit.source: This creates the new MyHandler class.
trans-unit.target: This creates the new MyHandler class.

trans-unit.target: Add the following import statements for the `MyHandler` class:

trans-unit.target: Next add the following members for the `MyHandler` class:

trans-unit.source: In the `MyHandler` class, add the following code to override the **onRegistered** method, which registers your device with the mobile service Notification Hub.
trans-unit.target: In the `MyHandler` class, add the following code to override the **onRegistered** method, which registers your device with the mobile service Notification Hub.

trans-unit.source: In the `MyHandler` class, add the following code to override the **onReceive** method, which causes the notification to display when it is received.
trans-unit.target: In the `MyHandler` class, add the following code to override the **onReceive** method, which causes the notification to display when it is received.

trans-unit.source: Back in the TodoActivity.java file, update the **onCreate** method of the *ToDoActivity* class to register the notification handler class.
trans-unit.target: Back in the TodoActivity.java file, update the **onCreate** method of the *ToDoActivity* class to register the notification handler class.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to add this code after the *MobileServiceClient* is instantiated.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to add this code after the *MobileServiceClient* is instantiated.
